page.title: 08THE FOSSE WAY
page.content: The{Fosse Way}- the old Roman road which originally ran from {Lincoln} through{Leicester}to{Cirencester}- is, as far as{Bingham,}the main route from {Newark }to {Nottingham.}Beyond{ {Bingham}much of the{Fosse Way}has been a dual carriageway for at least 10 years, but the stretch from{Newark}to{ {Bingham}remains unwidened. It carries a heavy load of traffic, and there have been numerous accidents along its length, particularly at{East Stoke}and other crossroads. Recently some passing places have been built at the crossings so that traffic can pass turning vehicles, which has helped the flow of traffic a little. {East Stoke, divided in two by this busy road, is one of the very few villages which are actually situated on the{Fosse.}
